conclusion: A square conductor frame with side length l moves with uniform velocity v from left to right through a magnetic field of width d, with l < d.
An induced current appears in the frame when there is a change in magnetic flux through the frame, according to Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction.
Identify 3 phases during the motion: entering phase, fully inside phase, and exiting phase.
During the entering phase, the area exposed to the field increases linearly with time, causing changing flux.
During the fully inside phase, the area exposed remains constant, so flux is constant.
During the exiting phase, the area exposed decreases linearly, causing changing flux.
Calculate time duration for entry phase: Time duration = l/v.
During the fully inside phase, there is no changing flux, so no induced current.
Calculate time duration for exit phase: Time duration = l/v.
Total time with induced current = l/v + l/v = 2l/v.
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is 2l/v.
